website_summaries.verdict: Another 700W blender option that blends quickly and evenly.
pros: Affordable price and a solid construction
Glass cup is large (fits 40 ounces) and features a convenient pouring spout
It's also super easy to clean
Fairly powerful, according to most reviewers
Simple to operate four button design
cons: The lid doesn't seal, so overflow does happen
Not everyone was impressed with its ice blending performance

customer_reviews.title: Nut, Fruits, Seeds, and particles of Ice are trapped below the Blades and never participate in the Blending process.
customer_reviews.text: I have only owned 4 Hamilton Beach Blenders in 25 years. The last HB Blender, a housewarming gift lasted four months. This one I purchased last June but used less than half a dozen times. It has been a disappointment for all my smoothies, and I do not dare use it for any other processing. The part labeled collar is open and performs as a trap for food particles to lodge at the bottom of the glass jar below the cutting blades. Nut, Fruits, Vegetables, Seeds, and Ice are trapped never participating in the remaining blending process. After cleaning, those particles are usually still trapped until they are sorted and individually picked out. I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Nadia

customer_reviews.title: You should know this is BAD blender
customer_reviews.text: I was really disappointed in this purchase. It barely blends fruits especially if they are frozen. You''ll have to pause the blending midway and stir. I noticed that the blender cup was hard to pull out of the base and today the piece got stuck and came apart leaving me with a smoothie all over my counter. JUST A WARNING.
customer_reviews.author: Sabra Morman

customer_reviews.title: people saying you get what you pay for, but this is awesome! :D
customer_reviews.text: I was a little bit concerned about buying it after I read a lot of reviews about this blender. The price is too cheap, and I was worried about the quality of blender. But unlike my concerns, this blender is really great! It works great, sturdy, strong and easy to clean! :) I really like my new blender! So glad I didn't spend 100 bucks for one blender!
customer_reviews.author: Stella Oh

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality blender
customer_reviews.text: Puchased July 2016. Used mainly for once a month smoothies. As of April 2017, the gears have burned out. I do not recommend this product. Update- blender has a 3 year warranty, but you must pay shipping of nearly $12...nearly half the cost of the blender. I will forgo a warranty claim and look into another brand.
customer_reviews.author: R. Fries

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for some months then it stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I really liked it because it was quite firm and it didn't make a lot of noise. I was doing smoothies on a daily basis, but then all of a sudden it stopped working. I hated cleaning the lid, but besides that it was a good blender. I wouldn't recommend it for small stuff like making pesto. I ended up buying an basic oster blender at walmart
customer_reviews.author: Pako

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality glass jar
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased the blender and and after just three blends the glass jug cracked. Did not drop it nor did it have any strong impact against it. An additional negative is that it has difficulty grating ice cubes. Sometimes I had to sit there and wait for them to melt.
customer_reviews.author: TheUnknown

customer_reviews.title: Smelled bad then started to smoke and does not blend.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this blender especially since I like Hamilton Beach products. First of all this blender wouldn't blend normally... I had to use the pulse button but even that barely blended. After pulsing for 5 minutes with minimal results, it started to smell strong. I took the jar off the base and saw smoke where they connect. I then flipped the base over and a lot of smoke started coming out of the vents. It smoked over 5 minutes. Thankfully I was able to return it. Used it only once**
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Average Blender
customer_reviews.text: The blender was pretty good when filled with liquids, but sometimes struggled when trying to puree foods, the blades didn't like not being immersed. The blades are driven by rubber sprockets which can put off a rubber-y smell when used for long periods. The rubber feet of ours stained out counter-top, even through a cloth oven mitt we had under it (see photos). It's very easy to clean and blades separate from housing easily. Does feel like a budget unit, light plastic, ours stopped working within 2 months, a grinding sound followed by the blades not moving anymore, blades and glass jar were intact, failure was somewhere in motor housing. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Flowers

customer_reviews.title: Not a good blender
customer_reviews.text: Not a good blender, the bottom is a cheap, light plastic piece that broke within 3 months of using, liquid all over the counter and floor. Also the lid on it has a part that is a plastic that does not close. You have to hold it shut with your hand so the liquid doesn't shoot out at you. What a joke! Who made this? lol Also I tried to go to Hamilton Beach website and purchase the jar collar and they no longer sell it because they know it's defective!! I am now looking for another blender. Does anyone have any recommendations? I use the blender for Bulletproof coffee every morning, that's it!
customer_reviews.author: CapeCodMom

customer_reviews.title: Brittle plastic parts, doesn't blend ice properly - SPEND THE EXTRA $ AND GET SOMETHING ELSE
customer_reviews.text: This blender only lasted us about 10 drinks. Mostly used it for protein powder shakes comprised of ice, fruit and powder. I added small amounts of each ingredient slowly but it didn't matter, the blender is not powerful enough to handle an ice tray of ice.... The motor sounds like it has something caught inside of it, probably plastic. After a couple of months it started to burn out and smoke. I wish I wouldn't have cheaped out on a blender.
customer_reviews.author: Clara

customer_reviews.title: Good For The Price
customer_reviews.text: This is a good blender for the price, but it's definitely not my favorite blender I've ever had. It's a little leaky, and it doesn't chop everything up. I make basic green smoothies with spinach and fruit, and I get full pieces of spinach not chopped at all in my drink. I have to make sure to stop the blender, stir, start up again, and repeat the process a couple of times to get it right. Also, the container is full glass so you have to protect it very carefully not to drop it or get a crack while washing it in the sink.
customer_reviews.author: Jake H.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the poorest quality blenders I’ve ever purchased. Never expected such a cheap product by Hamilton Beach. See the attached images, the blender cap is very flimsy and has a half baked finish.
customer_reviews.author: Mang

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm! Have had this machine for about a year now and it still works great. It is not the most powerful blender out there but especially for the price point works great and gets the job done. The glass is a nice addition, sturdy and it feels like it keeps a little cleaner than plastic jars I have had on blenders before. This is definitely great if you are on a budget and want a sturdy machine that will last a while -- perfect for smoothies and any other sort of blending. (If you use a lot of ice be a little patient though and make sure you have sufficient liquid)
customer_reviews.author: NL

customer_reviews.title: I got her drunk!
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking to get your wife or girlfriend drunk, for either some play time or just some peace and quiet while she sleeps it off, I highly recommend this blender and a pina colada recipe. Don't get fancy. Just a mix, some coconut rum and ice should do it. Its easy pour lid will allow you to keep topping her off without her noticing. Take advantage of the summer with this handy gadget.
customer_reviews.author: W. Eaves

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!!! Spend the extra $$ for a REAL blender!!!
customer_reviews.text: I received this product February 30th and have used it under 10 times between now and then... After about the second use I started to notice the blades dulled even more and would take 10 mins to make a simple basic smoothie (it could not grind the fruit down)... And after just 30 days of owning it, the product burned up and no longer works. It’s cheap for a reason. Just spend the extra $$ on a real, functioning blender. Don’t waste your money on this junk.
customer_reviews.author: ForeverYoung

customer_reviews.title: Will not blend Kale.
customer_reviews.text: Dislike almost everything about this. Except the price. Can pour ice into the top while blending. Top too tight. And, its critical flaw, it won't blend up the Kale in a smoothie. Leaves it too chunky. My last $20 blender from Walmart handled the Kale. This doesn't. I'm not one to complain, usually, but I saw other reviews that warned me of this. But, then I saw other reviews that says it makes great smoothies, so I went for it, thinking they naysayers were just crabby. lol. nope. It won't do Kale smoothie. So, if you want one of those, don't get this.
customer_reviews.author: jon g

customer_reviews.title: cheap
customer_reviews.text: This is a very LOUD blender. I bought this in April and it is now usable due to the black plastic ring base being cracked. I have tried to find a replacement part and it is impossible. I went to the Hamilton web site and they won't even allow me to contact them. They take you in a circle with poor customer service help. Save your change - you get what you pay for. I gave it 1 star because we did use it daily for 5 months - but I expected at least a year!
customer_reviews.author: AMB

customer_reviews.title: Lacks power, leaks
customer_reviews.text: This blender is ok for small, light jobs but it struggles to blend when one ingredient is frozen - the motor is not powerful enough for the blades to fully blend frozen fruits or vegetables into the rest of a smoothie, for example. The lid leaks around the edges during pouring despite being fully pushed into place. It’s fine for very simple blending and it’s easy to clean, but I did not find it up to the task of making smoothies.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: This is not the best blender on the market. Its small, loud and doesn't really work that well. Ice crushing always leaves small chunks of ice. Very difficult to make smoothies with as it doesn't always blend the fruits and ice placed into it. It is not very yummy when you are drinking a healthy smoothie that is supposed to be sweet and you get a nice chunk of the "healthy part" (vegetable) that wasn't properly blended. My advice spend a little more on a brand that works better.
customer_reviews.author: Hope E

customer_reviews.title: It was a nice blender while it lasted (only a few months)
customer_reviews.text: This blender worked great for a few months then one day while making salsa which is not something hard to blend, the motor started smoking and it smelled like burned. What's strange is that the blender still turns on but it smokes like it has fully broken down. It was not worth to try and keep and using it so we just threw it away before it causes a fire or something.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Sanz

customer_reviews.title: NOT EVEN WORTH THE PRICE, and some of the good reviews are fake
customer_reviews.text: I got this blender today and can't wait to try it. And it turns out to be the most terrible product design I have ever seen. The blade assembly is simply placed under the blender jar. So the water leaks out while the machine is working. This can cause a safety issue. What's more ridiculous is that it can't even chop celery. I just couldn't believe someone can use this blender to crush ice. So I checked the reviews on fakespot.com. Well, it looks like a great amount of the reviews are fake. Returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Fine Blender
customer_reviews.text: Though at first, from the photo, I thought this dispensed gum balls, I was relieved to see that it is another fine product from Hamilton Beach. I use it for blending, making smoothies, etc. and have had no problems with it. Sturdily built with all the functions you could possibly need, and at a great price. I have no reservations about recommending this, and only hope that the Hamilton Beech people offer me a few hundred shares in their company.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Salniker

customer_reviews.title: Won't chop dates
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace a blender that finally gave out. My main use for this product is to blend/chop dates mixed with a cup of almond milk. After running the blender at various speeds for some time, I began to pour the liquid into my glass and realized that the dates had not been chopped one bit. I poured the contents back into the blender and blended it for quite some time. The dates were smaller, but not by much. If a blender is not able to chop a soft date, I'm not sure it's worth much. I knew I wasn't purchasing a high end product, but I expected it to chop a few dates with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Walt Whitman

customer_reviews.title: Its ok
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing to use to push food down to blend. Therefore when making a smoothie with fruits, I have to constantly stop and use a spoon to push the fruits down to blend then continue. Although overall pretty powerful. I had my last blender for 16 years without an issue until it finally broke, I guess i just had higher expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Don't Say I Didn't Tell You So!! The motor starts smelling like it's burning in less than a minute!
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this blender about 5 times and already I'm smelling that funny smell like something is burning after less than a minute of blending. This is totally unacceptable. It wasn't even worth returning because they charge you a stocking fee. Not sure why- are they going to put it back on their shelf and sell it to someone else? Buy a different blender and save yourself the headache. UPDATE! I was washing the glass part in the sink, and, without hitting anything with it, a small piece of the glass chipped off. I didn't even notice it until I filled up the blender with liquid and it started spouting like a fountain!!
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: Took forever to do its job!
customer_reviews.text: I read other reviews before buying this item. Unfortunately, this blender takes forever to do its job...and all I put in there were strawberries and bananas and other soft vegetables! The sound is super loud and it takes more than 5 minutes to blend everything together. I am totally disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: HNguyen

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t blend
customer_reviews.text: Well it doesn’t actually blend. It kind of just throws things around for a while until you give up. The blade can barley chop up a strawberry let alone be an “ice crusher”. It’s very difficult to work with and I’m trying to find a different blade so I can actually make something with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jen Gambuti

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the $20
customer_reviews.text: Not easy to clean. Have to take blades and bottom apart to clean after every use. VERY LOUD. Definitely can’t use it when others are sleeping. When getting myself ready for work or for the gym. I can’t make myself anything using the blender due to its noise. The lid has this weird vented hold. So when you put anything powder in the mixer it puffs out Of the vent if you are. Or holding it down. Powder everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Kahler

customer_reviews.title: Pretty great little blender
customer_reviews.text: I have to say, I’m really surprised by how much I like this. After reading some of the reviews I was hesitant but it was offered for same day delivery and the price was great so I went for it. I used it to make margaritas on the first night and I’ve been using it for smoothies every since and it has no problem with the ice and mixing everything well. Of course it’s not as great as some of the $100+ blenders, but for the price it’s definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Hardin

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in an emergency when our old blender stopped working. Unfortunately, I wish I purchased a different one. This blender requires me to add a lot more liquid for a smoothie than my previous blender. It won't blend without a substantial amount of liquid. It also doesn't puree greens smooth. It is unable to puree kale and spinach into a smoothie so you are left with a undesirable texture that ruins the smoothie. Unable to return (missed the return window), but will be looking for another - more useful - blender. The only plus side is the easy cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Naughton

customer_reviews.title: Not so great
customer_reviews.text: Sorry, wanted to like this but even making smoothies was difficult. All the fruit would get stuck at the bottom everytime. After 2 months, it started to get real hot and smoking. I threw it out and bought the Ninja!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa D.

customer_reviews.title: Noisy but strong and good priced blender. Does the trick
customer_reviews.text: Works well for the price. Pros Very sturdy Crushes ice quickly and blends well Inexpensive Cons It is incredibly loud. Maybe because it is 700 watts? Other blenders I looked at were in the 450 range. The lid is a junky, cheap piece of plastic. I was surprised by this because both the base and glass jar seem high quality
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: It was great until....
customer_reviews.text: It was great until it wasn't. I've owned this blender for all of a month and a half. At times it stalls and kind of smells like it's burning and other times, it blends with precession. Until I noticed my smoothie leaking from behind the blender. It took some time to figure out what happened but I took it apart and noticed the rubber ring was torn. How that could have happened, only God knows.
customer_reviews.author: K. Wil

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: This is absolute trash. Buy something else. I bought this in Feb '19, I am writing this review Sept. '19 I probably used it somewhere under 20 times in that time frame. The motor has completely stopped working and won't turn on, and its past the return date. If I were you, I'd spend the extra money and get something better.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this to make salsa
customer_reviews.text: I like the lid that you can pour from. Other than that this product is terrible. I make salsa regularly and it will not chop veggies. The salsa button is a joke. My cilantro collects in the blades so therefore NOTHING gets chopped properly. I like chunky salsa but with this blender I misfit as well be eating a salsa salad. I’m looking to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: sandy

customer_reviews.title: I don't recommend easily or often but.....
customer_reviews.text: Actually a great blender for the price. Blade attachment is one unit so a separate rubber gasket isn't involved to cause problems and wear out before blender does. That's a huge advantage. My main use is for a protein smoothie adding frozen fruit. I would like a little more power but this one works well enough because it circulates the mixture extremely well ~ much better than I've ever seen. I don't recommend easily but I am basically very pleased with this blender.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Nice product for the price.  Not quiet.  Good, basic blender.
customer_reviews.text: Very decent price. Works well. I bought this after googling top quiet blenders. Three different sites had it in the top 5. I wouldn't call this quiet by any stretch of the imagination. HOWEVER my last blender was a gift and cost at least $150. This is a very decent unit and does what I want--pretty basic frappes, mixed drinks, smoothies. Nowhere near powerful enough for soup--but making soup in a blender isn't something I need or want. Just don't get a hankering for a Margarita in the middle of the night. It won't wake the dead, but you'll need to make enough for anyone who's asleep when you start mixing.
customer_reviews.author: MadamL

customer_reviews.title: Glass bowl is HEAVY!  Love the lid with pour spout.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this blender, it gets the job done. I thought there were more multiple speeds, but the 3 buttons and 2 pulse get the job done. Easy to clean, but I fear for the bowl to break since it's glass and HEAVY. I like the blade rotor is in its own casing, no fuss no muss. Push the rubber lid down all the way and the pour spout keeps it drip free.
customer_reviews.author: Long Island NY

customer_reviews.title: Can’t beat this price!
customer_reviews.text: I’m super happy with this purchase. I think this blender is fantastic for the price point. Bought this because I started a smoothie detox. Sometimes it struggles to chop up frozen fruit if I haven’t added enough liquid or let the fruit defrost enough, but otherwise no issues. Cleaning it is super easy and I’m blown away by the size and quality of it.
customer_reviews.author: Toni C.

customer_reviews.title: This is absolutely a junk model
customer_reviews.text: This blender is junk the lid didn't fit right. It lack any power and smelled like it was overheating the first time I used it. I hate this blender and regret buying it. I will never buy a Hamilton Beach product again. I was trying to replace my old one that was supposed to be the same model. Never buy this product. Update hamilton beach is giving me a hard time returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Jackson

customer_reviews.title: A very sturdy, slick addition to your kitchen counter useful for many functions!
customer_reviews.text: I had a very old Hamilton Beach blender inherited from my dad and decided it was time to update. So I ordered the Hamilton Beach Power Elite Blender with 12 functions! My husband uses it to make his protein drink and I use it to make my healthy frozen fresh fruit smoothie with kale and ice cubes! The blender works perfectly for both our needs! We love it!
customer_reviews.author: Vera Scanlan

customer_reviews.title: Broke after about 15 uses.
customer_reviews.text: Well I bought this item 2 yrs ago but I do not use it often. I used it about 15 times total. Like other reviewers mine broke in a similar spot. The collar of the blender that holds the blade to the pitcher to the base broke/snapped. Didn't even know. Went to pour milk into the pitcher and it spilled out the bottom. When it did work it did a so so job. I would use this to make pesto sauce and the nuts and small objects would get stuck under the blade in this "ring hole" if you will. It would always be a major pain to get these out and clean.
customer_reviews.author: redhotredsox2004

customer_reviews.title: This is horrible for grinding coffee beans!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for general use but mainly to grind coffee. This replaced one that stopped working. The previous one had no trouble grinding beans. This one is terrible. Beans and partially ground beans get caught in the space just below the blades. No matter how many times I empty it and regrind, the same thing happens. Horrible machine!
customer_reviews.author: Oldadmark

customer_reviews.title: Loud and Non-Stirring
customer_reviews.text: From the person for whom this was purchased: "Bought this blender to make "Banana Ice Cream" from frozen banana pieces. Have to stir constantly, even with lots of liquid. The blender is also extremely loud. On the up-side, it's sturdy, easy to use, and the pitcher is heavy glass so it probably won't explode like reviews of other blenders have mentioned. Hasn't exploded yet. So three stars. :)"
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Mitchum

customer_reviews.title: The lid is impossible to use
customer_reviews.text: The blender is fine, the problem is that the lid is so tight that it's impossible to use. You get everything in, put on the lid which is leak proof, but then once blended, good luck getting the lid off without dumping out what you just blended. I use a blender every day, the one I had before this was 25+ years old, I would rather use that anytime than this.
customer_reviews.author: Mom reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Bad product and replacement policy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this blender in April. After 2 months of using, it went dead. Some smoke came from the device. Contacted the customer service and was told to take the picture of the device, cut off the plug and pay $11 for the shipping charge for the replacement. Too tedious for me. I didn't do that. Went to nearby Walmart, bought the Oster blender and forgot what happened with Hamilton blender. Think twice before you decide to purchase Hamilton blender.
customer_reviews.author: topReview4you

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: So far, it's working as a blender should. I've had no issues with it but I am being a bit gentle with the blade assembly when taking apart for washing, as other reviewers have had this part break. It's easy to clean and when putting it back together, I do not tighten the blade parts too tight.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Terrible blender for smoothies
customer_reviews.text: My experience with this blender has been a disaster. The top does not seal well at all and liquid spurts out every time ... spent lots of time and towels cleaning up the kitchen each time I used this blender. At best you can only fill up half the jar to not splatter liquid all over ... so in all, this is terrible for smoothies.
customer_reviews.author: Cornelius Matteo

customer_reviews.title: My wife choice!
customer_reviews.text: This is what she wanted, even I suggested another one more powerful and a better brand, but I have to admit, this is doing the job. A bit noisy - but all are - we are using it daily and so far is excellent. I gave a 4 star to Easy to clean because by default, the way those are engineered there is no a easy way to take them apart and clean them in great detail. Overall - a good buy!
customer_reviews.author: Andrei Botez

customer_reviews.title: Does not start smoking and die
customer_reviews.text: I saw a lot of reviews saying this thing blew up after a few uses, but I think they just don’t know how to use a blender, or they are trying to blend car parts. It’s a blender, it blends my smoothies pretty well. Obviously you’ll want to make sure you crush that ice good before you just start blending it, but mine hasn’t blown up and I’ve had it for a few months, so fingers crossed.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica Tustin

customer_reviews.title: Ehh. Only good for liquids. Not solids
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace cheap blender that died. Went on a diet and was doing meal replacement with fruit smoothies. Well needless to say this blender doesn't blend for crap. Have to use a spoon to keep trying to get it to blend my fruit my milk and yogurt blend alright at bottom but like I said have to keep pushing my fruit down with big wooden spoon. Wouldn't recommend unless just blending liquid.
customer_reviews.author: Amy C

customer_reviews.title: Power
customer_reviews.text: I think this item is on the cheaper end of quality. I guess you get what you pay for. I is useful for light blending, but when you are trying to blend heavier vegetables, etc. much harder to use. You have to push material towards blades, which can be hazardous to the item doing the pushing.
customer_reviews.author: RL

customer_reviews.title: Very good considering the price
customer_reviews.text: Could be a perfect cheap blender, but: 1. The first button (Mix, Milkshake, Easyclean) stopped working after I touched it for 0.5 seconds by mistake. Not a big deal for us as we don't use it anyway. But it pretty much illustrates the quality of the product. 2. The lid is VERY hard to remove - my wife has to ask me to take it off when she wants to clean it. Anyway, it was ~25$, so we can live with it. We use it for cocktails, smoothies, etc., but it's capable of crunching ice cubes, so I tend to consider it powerful enough.
customer_reviews.author: Pavlo

customer_reviews.title: Blending power suuuuuucks!!
customer_reviews.text: The blending Power is horrible. I make a smoothie everyday and I use frozen strawberries. It takes me long periods of time and it will still either have while I blended strawberries left inside the smoothie or huge chunks of strawberries and then by the time I over blend the smoothie will be thin but the chunk of strawberries will still be there. I prefer a thick will blended smoothie and I can’t get that with this cheap machine. Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.author: donatta ibe

customer_reviews.title: Can barely blend
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this blender to make Banana milkshakes and Green salsa (made of soft tomatilloes). Nevertheless, I always find chunks of fruit, or whatever I'm blending, even when using the Max blend speed option. This is probable due to the blades, which lack edge and are bad positioned. On the other hand, it's still working and doesn't leak; except when it's full, as it may leak from the top.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Montes

customer_reviews.title: Makes the best Pina Colada I've ever made.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically as a bar blender, which is, it seems, the intended purpose. This makes the smoothest, creamiest, pina colada I've ever made, you just have to let it run a pretty long time. Also has made a pretty wicked mudslide. I've had more than a few bar blenders over the years, this 1 is a bargain for the quality it puts out. You can buy specialty bar blenders that make chunky, crappy, drinks. This thing may be plastic, but it works like a pro.
customer_reviews.author: shaun parks

customer_reviews.title: great blender. glass container.
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a plastic blender. it's much lighter. but it is just so much safer and environmentally friendlier with a glass blender. it blends my smoothie in 30 seconds. I think compare to the other fancy product on the market. this does the job with a much cheaper price.
customer_reviews.author: Will Cao

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after reading multiple good reviews! I got the package the other day, washed the pitcher and tried using it tonight. It started off nicely blending, but then started smoking out of the base!!! The house now smells like smoke! Thankfully it stopped smoking after 30 or so minutes. The base is still hot to the touch! Be safe and order a different brand!
customer_reviews.author: Dakota

customer_reviews.title: Blender
customer_reviews.text: The blender is a little smaller than I was expecting but still big enough for us. It is a thick glass not plastic which I didn't realize but again not a problem just unexpected. It is a little loud but most blenders are. My daughter loves smoothies so it gets lots of use.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Owens

customer_reviews.title: Already dying after six months of light use.
customer_reviews.text: After just six months of occasional use (making smoothies three times a week), the motor is burning out on this POS. Looks like all the money went iinto the glass carafe. Wife complained loudly about the burning electrical smell after running it only 10 seconds so I tossed it in the trash. You get what you pay for. Don't repeat my mistake, spend a little more money and get something decent.
customer_reviews.author: Capt Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Poor design - Leaks after less then 3 months
customer_reviews.text: In less than 3 months the bottom is leaking. The design is flawed as the washer that holds the blades connected to the blender jar is too think and rigid. Of course I cannot return it (discarded original packaging). Will try to contact Hamilton Beach to see if the have a replacement washer.. but at the price point feel like just throwing it in the black bin and starting over with a new brand..
customer_reviews.author: Shah

customer_reviews.title: This is the blender you want
customer_reviews.text: Perfectly blends a smoothie. Milk, ice, and protein powder....you’d swear it was an actual milk shake. Creates an interesting vortex that draws the liquid down to the blades. Just fill it, push the button, and forget it.
customer_reviews.author: jeff e.

customer_reviews.title: I wish I had not bought this blender
customer_reviews.text: I asked myself why not buy a cheap blender? What's the difference? Well, there is a difference. Sure it works OK. But it is not nearly as good as the blender I used to have which finally died. It doesn't seem to chop everything up, even with a lot of liquid. It's just kind of crummy. Because I have it now, I will live with it. But if I had to do it over again I would spend more money and get a better one.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy K. Wallingford

customer_reviews.title: Not for smoothies!
customer_reviews.text: I can't decide between one and two stars. Something about the shape of the jar seems to keep it from moving around like it should. It will not blend leafy greens, so don't even try. And the lid was so tight it was impossible to dislodge without spilling the mush all over the place. I gave it to the local animal shelter to blend food for kittens, where they love the tight lid. So all is well.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda R.

customer_reviews.title: Spend a little more for a better blender!
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT waste your money. I bought this to make my sons food and figured I didn’t need a fancy blender because I’m basically just mixing things like cooked sweet potatoes, sweet peas, green beans, etc. with breast milk. It takes 10+ minutes to purée already soft foods. I find it hard to believe it would blend frozen fruits and ice. Not to mention it is extremely noisy which is not a big deal, but for all the noise it makes you would think it would be pretty powerful.
customer_reviews.author: cmills

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: It’s loud but what blender isn’t? I like to make frozen smoothies, iced coffe/Frappuccino i think that’s what they are called. Also like to blend hot sauce. I’m sure I will blend more things but it work very well for all the things I have listed. I recommend especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Sammi

customer_reviews.title: Great value blender
customer_reviews.text: I use this mainly for making smoothies and it works well enough. Not as powerful as some other blenders out there, but for the price it’s great and has several nice presets. Works well at crushing frozen berries, but can’t quite get all of the raspberry/blackberry seeds.
customer_reviews.author: TP

customer_reviews.title: Great blender, a little noisy
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great blender! I’d recommend. I typically do smoothies and the occasional milkshake and it works fantastic. I use mainly frozen fruit and don’t usually have any problems. Once now I’ve just had to give it a little stir with a spoon but it blended fine after that. The one complaint is that it is definitely the loudest blender I’ve ever heard. I live in an apartment complex and try to be quiet because noise travels. Needless to say, this blender is not ideal for this situation. Luckily, it blends really quick (30 seconds max for a smoothie) so it’s not awful.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney Rees

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a basic blender, nothing fancy. I tried to blend some almond milk, a banana, some quick oats. The container was not even halfway full...and it could not blend it! I tried to help it along but really this was very basic stuff and couldn't handle much of anything!!! Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: mgpippo

customer_reviews.title: Just what you’d expect
customer_reviews.text: Overall just what I expected—it blended, but not at the super-smoothe level expected from smoothie stores. Rather loud, but I like how heavy the glass is, and the pour spout is one of the best! It doesn’t fall off, and pours without drips or spills.
customer_reviews.author: Aubrey Iacobelli

customer_reviews.title: Saddest “Blender” I’ve Ever Seen
customer_reviews.text: If you’re looking for a blender-shaped display case to show off how completely unblended all your smoothie ingredients are, then this “blender” is for you! None of the settings work. No matter which setting your choose, or what you put in, all it does is mush up the lowest 1/2 inch of stuff and leaves the rest untouched. Then you have to scoop out all your berries or ice cream scoops or whatever and...and what? Blend them by hand? Write a review on Amazon? The company DOESNT ALLOW RETURNS for its so-called blender, so enjoy popping those blueberries one by one.
customer_reviews.author: Max Shmookler

customer_reviews.title: Wrong choice of blender
customer_reviews.text: I’m so frustrated with this blender! The blades are set up wrong. Two of them point up, holding things instead of blending them. This makes blending difficult and takes lots of work; shaking and swirling things around to eventually get it to blend. I’m shopping for a different blender. Plan to take this one to goodwill. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Tina A

customer_reviews.title: Replacing my last Hamilton Beach - which lasted 20 years.
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this to replace my old Hamilton Beach blender, which just died. I had it for at least 20 years. Loved that one, and so far I love this one. I wanted one with a glass jar like my old one, and other than being shorter with a wider jar, which actually is a more ergonomic design - this is pretty much the same as my old one. Perfect for my morning smoothie and the random cooking uses - usually soup or salsa mixing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I love this blender. It's great for smoothies made with frozen fruit and veggies. The clean up is simple when following the included instructions. The noise level isn't great but it takes very little time to blend ingredients and shouldn't bother the neighbors.
customer_reviews.author: leelah

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth Even It's Low Price
customer_reviews.text: Worst blender I've ever had. I've been making smoothies daily for years and when I needed a new blender I thought this one might work fine based on the reviews. I thought .... hmmmmmm maybe those high priced blenders are not needed for smoothies? WRONG. I upgraded to the Ninja from Costco and what a difference! Perfect smoothie texture for a reasonable price. Since I'm past the return window on this piece of garbage some poor sucker will likely buy it from the local donation store.
customer_reviews.author: Teri

customer_reviews.title: Blending power is aweful
customer_reviews.text: I was bummed that this blender didn’t meet my expectations. It doesn’t blend thick milkshakes well, needs a good amount of liquid to blend good. I originally bought it for my sons baby food, but if it can’t make thick milkshakes I think baby food is a no go
customer_reviews.author: Cara Linville

customer_reviews.title: Listen to the reviews on this one
customer_reviews.text: Im not often one to believe reviews that are too negative if they are countered by great reviews at the same time. I went ahead and made the order but im beyond disappointed. I got this blender because my Ninja smoothie one wasn't even blending frozen fruit. I thought for sure this blender would at least do that. NOPE. The blades are far too small and it doesn't blend frozen fruit, ice--- just liquid really. DO NOT buy.
customer_reviews.author: Maria C. Velasquez

customer_reviews.title: Good For the price
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this less than 10 times. I tried making a smoothie and it would stop working in the middle of blending. Maybe frozen fruit was too much for it. I had to constantly move the fruit around with a spoon and continue. Overall it’s a good product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Finally, I bought a great blender that does the job!
customer_reviews.text: In the past, I have had the worst luck buying blenders. The models I bought left me with big chunks of ice and frozen fruit. This past weekend, I used my new Hamilton Beach Power Elite--and wow, my luck has changed. This blender is fantastic. I was amazed that I was able to churn one incredible well-blended smoothie after another--no ice or frozen food chunks to be found. The wave-action feature works well and is good at keeping the food moving towards the blades. Thanks to this blender, I have more than a dozen made-a-head smoothies in the freezer, which will provide a good, healthy, cool drink when the next heat wave hits.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected from a blender
customer_reviews.text: I bought this blender thinking it had sharp blades like all the blenders I've had in the past. Come to find out they were not sharp at all and very blunt so that many types of food would not blend up properly. I suppose it's good for milkshakes and powdered smoothies with soft bananas, but this is not what I bought it for only. I also had a hard time getting pieces of food that became constantly caught in the crack surrounding the blade section. Over all disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: after a couple of terrible Osters
customer_reviews.text: this one seems pretty good. It's quieter, the bottom of the jar (that fits into the base) is plastic so it won't rust like the Oster, and for my smoothie, it blended up the frozen fruit, which the Oster could do, as well as the peanut butter (which the Oster could never blend enough to incorporate it into the mix). I also added kale, which was great. I'm happy so far!
customer_reviews.author: Hanna

customer_reviews.title: I can't tell you how happy I am with this product
customer_reviews.text: I can't tell you how happy I am with this product, so much better than I expected. I first ordered an expensive commercial grade from you, too heavy etc, I gave it away within days and ordered the much less expensive Hamilton Beach and just love it.. The feature of being able to use mason canning jars (all sizes) is unbelievably convenient and such easy clean-up,,Never use the pitcher that came with it. Love it love it,,,,,
customer_reviews.author: Bestican

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy this blender
customer_reviews.text: I never write negative reviews, but I am so disappointed with this blender. It does not chop anything. When making smoothies, it only blends the very bottom bits by the blades. I have to turn it off and mix up the ingredients with a spoon multiple times before I can have a completely blended drink. I have tried adding more liquid, but it takes so much liquid to blend properly that by then it is basically juice. I will be purchasing a ninja next time.
customer_reviews.author: Alison Pfeiffer

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: This model does not work at all. Despite contacting customer service via email and telephone, they refused to replace or address my concerns and now I have a piece of junk that I regret must go to an e-waste dump. I tried to puree soft fruits and vegetables without luck and I tried to make a pesto sauce with fresh basil, grated parmesan and olive oil, but the blender did not blend; it just moved the materials around. I bought this blender to replace a Hamilton Beach model 57101 that had been working for 20+ years except for the lid that cracked.
customer_reviews.author: SoCal Home Cook

customer_reviews.title: Good Blender For The Money
customer_reviews.text: I just needed an inexpensive blender for smoothies and hummus. I have been making both for weeks now with no problems. Ice and fresh or frozen fruit blend efficiently and quickly with no lumps using smoothie mode. The blender makes really creamy hummus with chickpeas and olive oil. The blender is noisy but that's not a deal breaker for me. Good blender for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Chaney

customer_reviews.title: Terrible.
customer_reviews.text: Weak blender. Would've been fine with it but bottom fell off on its own immediately after I had filled it, oily mess splattered all over my kitchen. Very upset. Never had this happen with any blender before..
customer_reviews.author: Gen H.

customer_reviews.title: Sparks fly!! Becareful!!
customer_reviews.text: Just got in today and after rinsing out a few times and using it 3 times it works like a blender should. Nothing fancy. I am concerned about it sparking on me. I blended an iced coffee waited for it to stop and took it off when I removed it I seen a spark and a puff of smoke. Really concerning if I cant get help I will be returning it for safety purposes. Will update when I figure out a solution
customer_reviews.author: Desiree oooo

customer_reviews.title: I so wanted to like this...
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed! Bulky, cover sticks/difficult to remove. Only 4 buttons and only two stay down. I wanted something different than the everyday $20 blender—regret this purchase—nothing good to say on this
customer_reviews.author: Savvyshopper

customer_reviews.title: Best blender ever
customer_reviews.text: This is a well-made kitchen machine. The motor is powerful, the glass pitcher is heavy-weight and solid. Easy to assemble and disassemble parts for washing. The gasket is permanently attached to the blade assembly part (less chance of of a chopped gasket) and ensures more thorough cleaning, less chance of bacteria. And it also has a low speed Easyclean setting (2 cups warm water & 1 drop liquid detergent) which is easier & better than just rinsing prior to washing. I blend a protein shake every day (frozen berries, banana slices, fresh berries, protein powder & thick almond milk) every morning and the Easyclean makes my clean-up Easy!
customer_reviews.author: Linda S. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Useless Blender
customer_reviews.text: I originally got this blender to make smoothies in the mornings, however it hardly works. I find it painfully hard to blend up fruits and ice with a moderate amount of fluid. I would recommend spending more money to get a blender that actually works.
customer_reviews.author: Jongwoo Shin

customer_reviews.title: Cheap piece of garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Loud, and wouldn't blend a good almond butter in less than an hour. You could almost get it done faster with a mortar and pestle. Oh, and I have had it less than 2 months, and it's already leaking. Save your money and buy something that isn't a cheap piece of garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Southern Geek Belle

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Blender!
customer_reviews.text: This blender is GARBAGE!! I have had my old blender for almost 10 years and the bottom, plastic piece broke so we needed a new one. I know I didn’t spend more than $30 on it, so I thought this one would be okay. I make smoothies most often. I put the same ingredients in the same order in this blender and it did NOTHING. I don’t even use ice. Just frozen fruit, yogurt, and milk (it’s for my 2 year old daughter). It doesn’t even move the ingredients around. It is AWFUL!! Do not buy this blender. I will be returning it ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: Jena Crabb

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to like it, but not good.
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews before buying this blender, but I did want one on the low price point side. I've tried mixing the ratios of liquid to frozen fruit, but without fail there are always some things left unblended with this blender (no matter what setting I use). While the power is ok, I think the blades are just pretty low. The lid also will not stay on several weeks in (I have to hold it on top). Wouldn't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Madeleine

customer_reviews.title: Good little blender
customer_reviews.text: Makes great smoothies, but it’s necessary to blend it for what seems to me, a long time - minutes. I blend seeds, nuts, milk, spinach, tomatoes, fresh & frozen fruits, and protein powder - sometimes all in the same batch - not recommended due to too many calories. Mine came with the base, blender jar, and lid. The jar is thick glass which I like, everything else is plastic. Cleans easy enough, soap water , brushing action. Mine has two speeds, both are pulsing action.
customer_reviews.author: JA

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t blend anything but water
customer_reviews.text: The purpose of a blender is to blend. This could not blend any frozen fruit, standard ice or semi frozen fruit. The blade would not spin when it met resistance. However, if you poured water in the blender it would blend perfectly fine. Also, There is m little hole at the top where you can add more liquids while it’s blending, that will easily tear off if you’re not careful when washing it. Most blenders you can push the button on the blender and it will keep blending. With the one I received, you have to hold in the button for it to keep blending.
customer_reviews.author: Scot W

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I mainly use blenders for frozen drinks and smoothies and I can tell you it is awesome! Blends so smooth and has a easy clean way to pour the drink into a different glass. I a very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Alison Fox

customer_reviews.title: For the price, it's all you need.
customer_reviews.text: It does the job, and is pretty easy to clean in both the sink and the dishwasher. The blending power could be a little better for some things, as sometimes solid chunks have a hard time getting sucked into the blades, but a little shake usually works that out.
customer_reviews.author: bulletpark

customer_reviews.title: Totally satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: The glass jar is just the right size and has a durable, heavy feel. The pouring spout works quite well. It does a good job crushing and blending ice. I’m using the blender only for making smoothies and protein drinks. It works great for that, on a par with an expensive Cuisinart that I also have. This product is a great bargain considering what I use it for.
customer_reviews.author: Max Altus

customer_reviews.title: Works fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I have been using it for almost a year now. It has been working great and the blades are still sharp as before. The only thing to remember is that this is an entry level blender with a lower power motor. So there are some applications that require higher power where this blender does notwork that great.
customer_reviews.author: JG8

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Can't wait for summer smoothies. Tried blender and worked great. Did what I wanted with no problem. Have to wait for the ice chopping. Didn't try that yet but everything else good. Sturdy and nice heavy glass jar.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda

product_meta.title: Hamilton Beach Power Elite Blender with 12 Functions for Puree, Ice Crush, Shakes and Smoothies and 40oz BPA Free Glass Jar, Black and Stainless Steel (58148A)
product_meta.description: Color:BlackAll the power you need to: mix, puree, device, crush ice, and more - with only 4 simple buttons. 700-Watt of peak blending power. Do not fill blender jar beyond the 3-Cup (710-ml) level.
feature_bullets: 700 watts: Peak blending power for powerful ice crushing.
Wave action system: 700 watt power blender continuously pulls mixture down into the blades for consistently smooth results.
12 blending functions: Multi-function blender with only 5 simple buttons on the easy to read control panel. Power blender creates smoothies, icy drinks, shakes, and more.
Easy to clean: Blades remove for easy cleaning. Jar, blades, and lid are dishwasher safe for easy cleanup.
Clean, easy pour: Multi-function blender with unique, no mess pouring spout.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars7,816 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
